GDInfo.name: lng_cn
GDInfo.gstr: Scanning required to show resource data.

By the turn of the 22nd century, space exploration was dominated by corporate interests. Once a task for governments, space travel became a competitive market, where companies pushed boldly and blindly into the black, intent only on a return on investment.

For the first time in human history, Infinity Corp was about to attempt the colonization of a planet outside of Earth’s solar system. The construction vessel Mercury was launched to start the automated construction of an underground facility on an alien planet.

A small research team was also sent to survey the planet before a colony ship full of settlers left Earth. The research team would awake from stasis automatically, shortly after their arrival -- or, at least, that was the plan.

Congratulations on being an Infinity Corp Pioneer!
Mercury Fallen is still in active development and not feature complete. Thank you for joining the development journey.
Game manual available by pressing [Tab] to open the Facility Management Interface and selecting Manual at the top.
Deconstruct {0}? This will immediately deconstruct this surface structure. Any delivered materials will be returned to the receiving container.

Mercury Fallen is in a state of active development and is not feature complete.
Should you encounter any issues, certainly let me know. Only through feedback can I ensure we squash these pesky bugs and continue to add great new content.
Used to determine how the game world is generated
Game starts with an additional colonist and robot.
The default start with 3 colonists and 1 robot.
A more challenging start with fewer starting colonists.
Error loading save game. Incompatible save game version or file is damaged.
Opens the contact/report form on the Mercury Fallen website
Quit to main menu? Any unsaved progress will be lost.
Drag & Drop to set load order
Upload {0} to Steam Workshop? By clicking OK you confirm that you are either the creator of this mod content or have proper permissions to upload it under your username.
Unexpected error occured while setting and uploading mod content
Remove Object being constructed will be removed.
No discovery items found. Make discoveries by opening item chests and exploring the world.
Object is broken or not operational
Not connected, not enough power or structure disabled.
Remove all objects in the construction queue?
Total water consumption over total water generation
Cloning additional colonists could result in oxygen deprivation.
Set robot to be recycled. Robot will go to an available Robot Recycler.
Robot is marked for recycling. Click to cancel.
This will remove the POI from the map. Continue?
Bait Bait is required in order to attract and collect resources. Delivered by Biologist
Efficiency Determined by the amount of adjacent water tiles. Affects collection speed.
Waiting For Area To Be Cleared
Sets this object to first place in the build queue.
Sets this object to last place in the build queue.
Colonists will do jobs with a higher priority first if they can. 1 = High Priority, 10 = Low Priority.
Minimum Smarts Required To Perform Job
Minimum Muscles Required To Perform Job
Minimum Athletics Required To Perform Job
If checked colonist will collect produced item and deliver to storage. Otherwise they will drop it on the floor.
{0} of this item will be crafted. Item order will be removed upon completion.
Item will continue to be crafted if there is less than {0} available. Item order will not be automatically removed.

No Crop Assigned Click To Select Crop

Chance to generate double research points. Bonus is based on room efficiency and is capped at 50%. Room Efficiency: {0:P0}
Colonists will add fuel when current fuel level is at or below this amount
Unable to scan for additional points of interest. Too much interference from existing points of interest.
Deconstruct Vehicle Vehicle must docked at facility.
Deconstruct Vehicle? This will deconstruct the vehicle and recover some of its materials.
Remove equipment: {0}? Equipment item will be destroyed in the removal process.

Available Equipment Slot
Click To Choose Equipment

Available Equipment Slot
Vehicle Must Be Docked To Install Equipment

Select Points Of Interest Distance: {0} Add/Remove Finish Selection
Setting destinations for your expedition is an optional step to automate POI exploration. The expedition can be manually controlled once it embarks.
Decor score of room. Can be improved by adding decorations. Value: {0:P0}
The current lighting level of this room. Can be improved by adding lights.
The efficiency of this room is based on the decor and lighting values and can affect colonist actions in various ways depending on the room type.
{0} has contracted a new ailment {1} from {2}
{0} failed to craft {1}. Recipe materials have been lost in the process.
{0} failed harvesting {1} and lost half of the harvest
{0} failed to refuel generator. Fuel spill requires cleanup.
{0} critically failed while treating patient {1}. Not sure how to say this, but {1} is dead.
We've generated as many {0} as we can currently store
{0} has docked at the primary facility
{0} is feeling super motivated today and will work faster for the next 24 hours.
A cave in has occured! Areas without walls or flooring are structurally unstable and can collapse.
A crop has become diseased! The crop should be cleared before it spreads.
{0} is feeling depressed today and will work slower for the next 24 hours.
A strange type of xeno mold has been spotted. It appears to be rather invasive. It should be cleaned up quickly before it spreads out of control.
{0} has contracted a new ailment {1} from {2}
{0} critically failed while constructing {1}. Structure and materials have been lost.
{0} failed to craft {1}. Recipe materials have been lost in the process.
{0} critically failed while researching {1}. Research progress lost.
{0} critically failed while refueling {1}. Fuel item lost in the process.
{0} critically failed while harvesting {1} and lost half of the harvest.
{0} critically failed while treating patient {1}. Not sure how to say this, but {1} is dead.
The prominent hominid from the planet Earth.
The prominent hominid from the planet Earth.
A basic robot capable of mining, building and hauling.
A hefty bot capable of mining floor ore tiles.
A basic robot capable of mining, building and hauling.
A hefty bot capable of mining floor ore tiles.

The prominent hominid from the planet earth.
O2 Generators required to increase cap.
Complex machines capable of performing some human duties
Overall health of the colonist. When this drops to zero the colonist has perished.
Robots will recharge at an available charge pad
A hungry colonist is an unhappy colonist
A happy colonist is an efficient colonist. Ensure they don't get too stressed out or accidents may happen.
Increases carry capacity by 5 per point
Increases job experience gain by 10% per point
Increases movement speed by 5% per point.
Base movement speed. Movement speed is additionally modified by Athletics.
Base movement speed. Movement speed is additionally modified by Athletics.
Base movement speed. Movement speed is additionally modified by Athletics.
Base work speed. Work speed additionally modified by job skill level.
Objects will break down if durability drops below 5%. Repaired by technician.
Objects with low reliability may malfunction, take damage or break down.
Ate a meal I don't like
Performed a job that I love
Performed a job that I like
Performed a job that I dislike
Performed a job that I hate
I have pretty low expections at the moment
I had a bit of a mental break, but I'm feeling better now.
Nothing like a video game to relieve some stress
Nothing like lobbing pointy sticks into a target to relieve some stress
I really love eating {0}. Reduces stress when eating this food.
I like eating {0}. Minor reduction to stress when eating this food.
I hate eating {0}. Increases stress when eating this food.
I don't like eating {0}. Minor increase to stress when eating this food.
People just enjoy being around me. Chance to reduce stress of nearby colonists.
I'm not always annoying, sometimes I sleep too. Chance to increase stress of nearby colonists.
I really love being a {0}. Reduces stress when performing this job.
I like being a {0}. Minor reduction to stress when performing this job.
I dislike being a {0}. Increases stress when performing this job.
I really hate being a {0}. Minor increase to stress when performing this job.
I am a frail vessel full of errors
My body is a temple, which was apparently shot in to space
I feel like I'm always hungry
The situation could be worse I suppose
I really feel like I could seize the da- *snores*
I'll sleep when I'm dead or eventually. Whichever comes first.
I want to run. Can I run? Let's run. I'm gonna run!
Slow and steady wins th- What was I talking about?
I don't really want to work. Why am I even here?
You don't get what you wish for, you get what you work for
After hours of chess playing this colonist is a bit smarter
I was dropped as a child, but there were no long term effects
Who wants to carry around lots of stuff anyway?
I don't like getting wet. Unable to walk through water tiles.
Fear of cooking. Unable to perform cooking tasks.
Fear of dirt. Unable to perform mining tasks.
Fear of computers. Unable to perform research and comm officer tasks.
Fear of animals. Unable to perform biologist tasks.
Fear of plants. Unable to perform botanist tasks.
Fear of blood. Unable to perform doctor tasks.
Sitting in the fetal position should help me relax.
Walking back and forth is a great way to relieve high stress.
My stomach doesn't feel so well when I get stressed.
I like to damage things when I'm stressed out.

Dumping Carried Items On The Floor

Rocking back and forth in a fetal position to reduce stress

The Distance Operated Geo Explorer is a surveillance vehicle designed for remote exploration and biome scanning.
An improved surveillance vehicle that can travel over water.
Passenger vehicle that will allow colonists to investigate points of interest on the surface.
Improved passenger vehicle that will allow colonists to investigate points of interest on the surface.
Vehicle capable of mining up to sub-surface resources
Advanced mining vehicle capable of mining up to sub-surface resources that can travel over water
A basic resource transport vehicle that can be assigned to buildings for automatic resource retrieval.
An advanced resource transport vehicle that can traverse water. Can be assigned to buildings for automatic resource retrieval.
The time, in seconds, per mining cycle.
Time, in seconds, it takes to perform a scan.
The radius of tiles explored when covering new ground.
Total number of items that the vehicle can carry.
Power storage amount. Power is used for various actions and recharged during the day using solar power.
The speed the vehicle will recharge using solar panels. Vehicles are unable to recharge at night.
Scan an unknown resource location or POI for more information.
Set the target destination for this vehicle.
Automatically transport items from resource gathering buildings. Vehicle will prioritize collecting from buildings to which it is assigned.
Empty vehicle inventory into adjacent facility. Items will appear next to elevator.
Return the vehicle to the vehicle bay. Vehicle must be in a map tile adjacent to the primary facility.
Scan biome for discoveries and available resources
Automatically uncover new areas and scan biomes
Explores POI Locations set during expedition creation
Mine available resources on this tile
Mine a selected resource. Miner will deposit resources at nearest facility or depot.
Investigate the point of interest in the active tile
Convert the vehicle to a mining platform
Convert the vehicle to a radar tower
Repairs damaged objects, installs equipment items and recharges the EMG.
Cooks meals at the cook station
Works at the research station to generate research points
Scans for surface resources using the Resource Scanner
Hauls Items to and from containers as well as refills fuel.
Generated at the computer station and are used to unlock research projects.
Used to unlock technology research projects
Used to unlock biological research projects
A small item crate containing items on the ground.
Apparently even on an alien world dirt is everywhere.
Granular material composed of finely divided rock and mineral particles including silica.
It's harder than dirt and I think it's made of different stuff.
A mineral form of iron oxide.
A very hard and relatively pure version of carbon that burns cleaner than coal.
A soft mineral form of copper.
A water puddle. Also known as a safety hazard.
The contents of a colonists stomach for all to see.
A puddle of fuel. Doesn't look great.
A large blue capped edible fungus. Can be harvested for resources.
The genetically modified potato seed from the original mission has grown in the underground soil. Can be harvested for resources.
An invasive and fast growing mold.
Connects the underground facility to the surface.
Burns anthracite to generate power. Simple, messy and effective.
Burns solid fuel to generate power. Simple, messy and effective.
The Emergency Mechanical Generator converts mechanical energy into electrical energy. A technician will need to charge up the device regularly.
Stores electrical energy for later use.
Stores electrical energy for later use.
By tapping thermal vents, we can generate sustainable power that doesn't require fuel. Must be placed over thermal vent.
In order to grow our population we'll need more of these.
Hoovers up water and spits it out in to water conduits. This thing really sucks. Must be built on water.
A scientist will work at this station to generate research points.
Surveyor will use this station to scan for hidden deep resources on explored planet tiles.
A small field to grow crops. Must be placed on dirt.
No longer are we required to toil in the unpredictable task of normal procreation. The clone chamber allows us to create the ideal colonists.
The only means of safely traveling from one star to another without dying of old age.
This stasis capsule has already been opened. Internal logs show the capsule was opened at the planned revival time. There is no sign of the original occupant.
This robot doesn't appear to be damaged and is just powered off.
With the miracle of modern science the door opens and closes all by itself.
This door shall slide no more.
A larger container for storing raw materials.
A general purpose container for storing non-food items.
Storage container for crops and seeds.
A place to store and retrieve meals.
The data server increases the amount of research points we can store.
Access point for items that are needed on the surface.
Access point for items delivered from the surface.
A far more comfortable option than the floor while being unconscious.
A slight improvement over sleeping on the floor.
A high tech means of displaying light.
A decorative stack of illuminated balls.
A decorative bookcase in a sleek hexagon design.
Night time underground is probably hard to notice.
A nice way to spruce up the place.
Sometimes lockers store stuff and sometimes they just sit there to look cool.
Punching a padded pole will increase muscles.
Running in place for a while will help increase athletics.
A controlled environment for faster plant growth.
A sophistacated way to grow beneficial sludge.
A decorative object to keep colonists happy. Don't tap the glass.
A place for growing and harvesting fish.
It slices, dices and grinds. Oh my.
Playing a game of Soul Survivor will help reduce stress.
Throwing some short pointy sticks should help reduce stress.
Can be placed over water to capture small water critters.
A station for making nutritional plant mixtures.
A nice place to sit and relax.
A nice place to sit and relax
Refine raw ore in to ingots.
A craft station used to refine raw bio materials.
An advanced 3D printer used to construct electrical and mechanical technologies.
Remotely control the vehicle bay machinery for the construction of vehicles.
In order to monitor surface operations we'll need a map table.
It slices, it dices. Recycle robots to get back construction materials. Set robots for recycle from a robots info panel.
Robots will use charge pads to restore power.
Heals the sick as long as there is a good doctor.
Used to transfer job skills from one colonist to another.
A place for up to four colonists to enjoy a meal.
A consistent reminder not to walk in that direction.
The aging remains of the Mercury facility.
Speedy electron travel to machines in need.
Perfect way to get water to machines in need.
A cargo chest containing various organic materials.
A cargo chest containing various technology items.
A cargo chest containing various minerals.
A cargo chest containing various food supplies.
There is a note attached to the side that simply says: "Good Luck. -A.K."
The surface side of the research facility in all it's glory. While it shows some age, everything appears to be in working order.
For the construction of vehicles to explore and exploit the planet surface.
Mines selected materials in an area around the platform.
Adds additional tiles around the tower that can be scanned for points of interest.
Allows access to the shipping & recieving inventories by vehicles

We should send out an expedition team to investigate this area for possible flora research.
We should send out an expedition team to investigate this area for possible fauna research.
We’ve found what appears to be an ancient mine shaft. There may be some remaining resources we could harvest.
What remains of the original survey rover sent by Infinity Corp.
The remains of a strange space vessel settling in the swamp.
A large green space vessel was spotted in this area.
A rather large space ship has crashed here.
A small alien structure with a smooth outer door.
This area contains some natural flora.
Some fish were spotted in the nearby waters.
This area contains some natural algae
This area contains some natural flora.
This area contains some natural flora.
This area contains some natural flora.
This area contains some natural flora.
This area contains some natural flora.
Glowing metal spheres were spotted here. We should investigate.
The remains of an alien shrine
A tall alien figure has been seen wandering aimlessly.
A sparkling glint was discovered on one of the sand dunes.
The crumbling remains of a large facility near the sea.
A strange signal was picked up at this location.
An ancient ruin covered in vines
An ancient facility that shows little damage.
The crumbling remains of a large facility near the sea.
An ancient facility that shows little damage.
The remains of an ancient travel network.
A small natural cave giving off a strange signal.
The crumbling remains of an ancient stadium.
The cave does not appear to have formed naturally.
A strange vessel is parked at this location.
Twisted metal and debris have been spotted.
An ancient structure in good condition.
It's a bit crunchy under ones feet.
This could be a good potential source of power, if we can learn to harness it.
At least we're pretty sure it's water.
A mineral form of iron oxide.
A soft mineral form of copper
A very hard and relatively pure version of carbon that burns cleaner than coal.
The kitchen is used for making "tasty" food.
Great for getting from one room to another.
For the production and storage of vital resources such as power.
A room for refining raw ingredients in to usable materials.
For assembling robots and advanced components.
The science lab is crucial to the research of new technologies.
A place for your colonists to relax and have fun.
A dedicated space for your colonists to play dead for a while.
Any proper facility needs a place to heal the sick.
A space for growing algae, fish and better plant growth via aeroponics.
A dedicated space for the storage and consumption of food.
A room for managing and monitoring surface activity.
Padded gym flooring to ensure safe physical training.
No flooring found for this room. Add flooring to determine the type of this room.
Defines an area for growing plants in the dirt.
Defines a room zone. Room zones must be surrounded by walls and have at least one door.
A mixture of minerals that can be further refined in to usable material.
A malleable material that cures in to a dense and durable structure.
A mineral form of iron oxide.
A harder and purer form of carbon than coal.
A soft mineral form of copper.
A mineral composed primarily of titanium dioxide.
Granular material composed of finely divided rock and mineral particles including silica.
A renewable fuel source that is not as efficient as anthracite.
A commonly misunderstood crop that can be used to make plastics.
A glowing plant bulb containing a cluster of sticky fibrous membranes.
I fibrous and comfy material used to make comfy things.
A strange and pointy grain plant that can be processed to make flour.
A sweet fruit that looks a bit like an orange banana.
An edible polyphyletic organism. This could also be used to generate nutrients for better plant growth.
A large blue capped edible fungus.
A spongy, and sorta slimy, vegetable crop.
It's a bit slimy. Probably best to cook it first.
It's a bit slimy. Probably best to cook it first.
A powdery mixture made from processing Wheat Thorn. I think we can make some bread with it.
Processed fishy bits. Still a good idea to cook it first.
Required liquid nutrition for growing plants in the Aeroponics Farm.
Various technology fragments that can be used to further research.
An amorphous solid derived from silica.
A hard and brittle crystalline solid used in electronics.
The fourth most abundant element in the Earth's crust. It's rather abundant here too.
A soft metal with high thermal and electrical conductivity. Great for electronics.
A strong metal alloy composed of iron and carbon.
A lustrous metal with a silver color, low density and high strength.
A dense, malleable precious metal with impressive conductive properties.
A small repair kit used to repair machinery.
A more efficient repair kit used to repair machinery.
A highly efficient repair kit used to repair machinery.
Not all that filling, but better than a raw potato
I'm pretty sure this is an emergency.
A multi-colored array of vegetable goodness.
Far more filling than just a potato.
Maybe it's the environment, but this is the best sandwich I've ever had.
Just like Mom used to make.
It's wrigley and gross, but fish seem to like it.
A durable, but biodegradable, plastic used for construction.
Various electronic parts used in advanced construction.
A decorative flowering plant with a sweet smell.
Crop is ready for harvesting. Available botanist will come and harvest crop.
Crops will wither if not harvested in time by a botanist.
Crop is currently infested with a disease. Disease can spread to nearby crops if not cleared.
Fish are in need of a food delivery from a biologist.
Fish have died from lack of food.
The Bio-Refiner will unlock the ability to craft construction materials.
Better than sleeping on the ground.
Unlocks the ability to make proper meals and raw food storage.
We'll need to start processing metals if we hope to rebuild the facility.
I'm sure there is a source of water around here somewhere.
After extensive testing we've learned that humans, apparently, can't live without oxygen.
A fun new way to relieve stress.
The gym will allow us to improve some of our colonists attributes
Improved repair kits will allow us to repair machines more efficiently.
Even better repair kits will allow us to repair machines more efficiently.
Construction of the elevator and map table will allow us to start sending out expedition parties to investigate points of interest.
Unlocks the ability to store electrical energy for later use.
Using anthracite as a fuel source will help increase our power generation for further expansion.
Larger batteries will allow us to store even more electrical energy.
By tapping thermal vents, we can generate sustainable power that doesn't require fuel.
This will allow us to harvest resources from the surrounding water.
The questionable ability to make new people.
This new technology will allow us to copy job skills from one colonist to another.
Nothing quite like a good sit down.
Hopefully some decorations will calm people down around here.
Nothing quite like a good sit down.
Physical labor is great, especially when it's not me.
Now we can recover some materials by squishing our robots into tiny bits.
In order to mine ores on the ground we'll need a deep driller bot.
Increases max attribute points that can be assigned during robot construction.
Increases max attribute points that can be assigned during robot construction.
Increases max attribute points that can be assigned during robot construction.
Increases max attribute points that can be assigned during robot construction.
Data servers will allow us to store more research data.
Having a dedicated eating area will be good for morale.
The food processor can make ingredients for better meals.
What is with all these hand cramps?
A superior method of plant cultivation that doesn't require one to get their hands dirty.
Fertilizer will allow us to increase plant growth.
The scientific study of plants & algae.
The construction of vehicles will allow us to further explore and exploit the surface.
The resource scanner will allow us to scan for deeper resource deposits on the surface. Sub-surface deposits will require the use of a mining vehicle.
This will allow mining vehicles to be converted into mining platforms. We can start to automate resource gathering using resource transport vehicles.
We should begin exploring the surface of this world. The map table will allow us to visualize the surface and check out points of interest found by the comm station.
Now that we have a better idea of what's out there, we need to start harvesting those resources for further expansion.
Unlocks new hover variants of existing vehicles that allow traversal over water.
Processing silica will allow us to craft glass and silicon carbide for advanced technologies.
A decorative plant with a crimson colored flower.
This will unlock various equipment that can be crafted to improve machines and objects.
This will unlock various equipment that can be crafted to improve machines and objects.
This will unlock various equipment that can be crafted to improve vehicles.
This will unlock various equipment that can be crafted to improve vehicles.
This will unlock various equipment that can be crafted and equipped by colonists.
This will unlock various equipment that can be crafted and equipped by colonists.
Display Mode Options For Planet Map. Install in Map Table.
An extremely hot and dry area devoid of any flora.
A sea of sand dunes and extreme temperatures with very low moisture.
A dry and somewhat barren area.
Giant crystal structures cover this biome. A truly breathtaking sight. It’s unclear what caused such extensive crystalline growth above the surface.

The bio diversity generated here in such a short period of time is astounding. A colorful array of thick vegetation and sweltering heat fill this region. Much of the vegetation is strangled by over sized vines that twist through the area.
While there is more moisture content here, there is little in the way of flora and fauna.
An area consisting of various shrub like plants and sparse grass.
There is a sparse amount of large flora, but various grass like plants cover the area.
Dense vegetation blocks out nearly 90% of the radiant light and heat from the sun. Various bioluminescent plants grows within the darkness leaching nutrients from the surrounding tall trees.
A heavily forested wetland. A small structure was found, but there are no signs of the occupant.
A dry and dusty environment containing only small flora.
A dry and dusty environment containing only small flora.
Small rolling hills covered in a blue grass like plant. While there is some diversity in flora the blue grass is the predominant species.

Several different types of fungi grow in this region including large fungal stalks growing to over 20 feet in height. The outer skin of the larger specimen has a thick, bark like, exterior which serves to protect the fungi and support it’s massive size. The lack of seasonal transitions allows for extended growth of this fungus which results in its size.
A relatively marshy area with tall grass like plants.
A cold, harsh and rocky area devoid of flora.
A cold, harsh and rocky area with little flora.
Despite the cold and harsh climate a forest of tendril trees is prevalent. The outer layer of these plants are smooth and waxy. This appears to aid in its ability to survive in the colder climate.
The ground here is covered in permafrost and allows for little in the way of flora or fauna.
Despite the cold and harsh climate a forest of tendril trees is prevalent. The outer layer of these plants are smooth and waxy. This appears to aid in its ability to survive in the colder climate.
Snow and ice as far as the eye can see.
Snow and ice as far as the eye can see.
Snow and ice, intermixed with frigid waters, as far as the eye can see.
Similar to earth, river water flows from the mountains down to the sea.
One could almost mistake the scene for being earth as one stares out into the ocean from the sandy shore.

My name is Doctor Alex Kenner. Something has gone terribly wrong. I awoke from stasis, but the other members of the research team have not. The system appears to be in some sort of lock down and, unless I missed a briefing, this should not be the case. Mission protocol states that the research team stasis capsules are suppose to open shortly after arrival at the Mercury facility. My stasis capsule appears to be the only one functioning properly. The comm satellite is online and I’ve dispatched the relevant data back to earth.

The facility AI has been shutting me out of more systems. It indicates that there are issues with the stasis systems, but is expecting an engineer to fix it. The engineer is one of the people still in stasis. This system was supposed to be fail safe, but no one thought of this scenario? Who designed this bloody system?

Still no word from Earth comm. I’m a botanist, not an engineer. I’m liable to kill them if I try to repair the systems myself. Given I’m the only one awake, I have plenty of food rations to last for now, but I certainly don’t want to stay here alone. The robots are still functional and I’ve started a daily log.

I received an automated message back from Earth. I would like to state for the record that this automated message simply says: “Congratulations on a successful landing. We look forward to further reports.” I sprained my ankle after kicking one of the robots.

I’ve started naming the robots. One of the robots has a malfunctioning servo, coincidentally after I kicked it. It has a bit of a hop to its step now so I’ve named her Bunny. I realize it’s silly to infer genders to these things, but after two weeks alone I’ve decided I don’t care.

I’ve heard it said that having a daily routine is important in a survival scenario, but I’m deeply concerned that I’ve accepted that this is a survival scenario at this point. In the mornings Bunny and I take a jog from the Botany Lab down to MedBay. After that we complete a full inspection of the facility. I found the inspection checklist in storage.

I took a trip to the surface today to take soil samples. I’ve been so focused on other tasks to keep my mind occupied that I forgot about my actual assignment here. The original surveys of the planet indicated a high level of solar radiation on the surface, but a breathable atmosphere and adequate moisture content. The radiation levels are far lower than was originally estimated and appear to be in decline. The surrounding area from the facility shows signs of limited plant growth.

I’ve received additional automated responses back from Earth, but nothing that would be considered a valid response to the situation we’re in. It’s only been a month, but I have little hope in getting more than that. We all signed on knowing this was a one way ticket, but I wasn’t expecting to be here alone. At least I have Bunny.

What little data I’ve managed to get from the stasis systems indicates that the stasis capsules are due to unlock in several hundred years. Primary facility power will never last that long, but the backup batteries in the pods themselves should last indefinitely.
I’m not entirely sure how to feel about that. I find I’m no longer angry about my situation, but it now appears that I’ll be living the remainder of my life inside my own tomb. Bunny says hello.

While I still have plenty of rations I’ve decided to start growing some of the crops from storage. The hydroponics system is working quite well and it’s nice to be focusing on something other than daily system checks. I’m starting to wish the hemp we brought was something I could smoke.

I’m not sure if my mind is playing tricks on me, but I saw a light in the distance when out collecting samples. It blinked. I thought it must have been a glinting reflection off something in the distance so I went back outside at night. It was still there. I stared at it for almost ten minutes before it suddenly stopped. Bunny thinks I’m just seeing things.

Further research on the surface shows the solar radiation is declining far faster than expected. No sign of the blinking light. Moisture levels show a dramatic increase which would indicate that the surrounding area could become forested by the time the team wakes up. Speaking of which, I’m unsure what the team will awake to as far as the facility is concerned, given that it was never meant to last that long without proper maintenance.

Many of the earlier log entries have gone missing and I’m not sure why. They show as deleted, but I certainly don’t remember deleting any entries. Could be some sort of data corruption in the files. Bunny insists that she didn’t do it, but I’m not so sure.
The blinking light in the distance returned. Bunny saw it too. The excursion suit won’t last for that distance and the radiation levels are still too high. I can’t risk it.

I thought I almost lost Bunny today. She fell over and there was a sudden burning smell. Thank god they were made to be modular. The vision sensor fried, but I was able to plug in a replacement from storage. Damn it, Bunny, don’t scare me like that!

Years’ worth of records are no longer in the system. Some of them I deleted myself, but I don’t remember deleting the others. Maybe I deleted them all. I’m not sure it’ll make any sense to whoever reads these, IF someone reads these.

I need to know what’s out there. The solar radiation has fallen to a point where I don’t need the excursion suit. I’ve already taken some trips outside without it. I’m not sure what we’ll find out there, but I know what I’ll find down here. Bunny is excited for the trip and, frankly, so am I. It’s been a long time since I’ve felt excited. I’ve deactivated all of the robots. I’m not sure we’ll return.

We’re ready to go. Given the terrain I estimate it’ll take about a day and a half to reach the source of the blinking light. We’ll be heading out in the morning. The blinking light source is no longer visible due to flora growth, but I have a heading and a boat load of curiosity. Also bunny. Can’t forget Bunny.

We’re on the road! I wish there were roads. It’s been a tough hike and we’re taking a short break under a rocky outcrop. Bunny has slowed me down a bit, but I’m glad she is here. I packed a solar charger for her and rations for me. It’s hard to believe we’ve been on this planet for over 5 years now. The landscape has changed so much in that time.
The radiation-soaked wasteland has given way to quite a wide variety of flora and fauna. I still don’t understand how this much growth can occur over such a short amount of time. Bunny and I found a cave and are spending the night. We’ve only seen smaller fauna, but the possibility of larger fauna can’t be ignored. There is so much I don’t understand here.

We found what appear to be animal tracks outside the cave this morning. The shape is quite alien. I suppose, though, I’m the real alien here. We should be at the source of the blinking light later today.

I’m not sure what I was expecting to find. The source of the blinking light was the destiny rover that was sent during the initial planet survey. The solar panel is still operational, but the satellite uplink looks damaged. There is captured data that was never sent back. Bunny should be able to interface and download the data from the rover.

Wow. I’ve been reviewing the data that Bunny downloaded from the rover. Some of the images show what appears to be a small angular structure. This can’t be a natural formation. The coordinates indicate that it’s not far from here. If I ration the rations (heh), I think we should be able to see the structure for ourselves. Wow.

I sampled some of the alien flora this morning. After some initial observations, it appeared to be edible. I ate it. All right, eating alien flora is not the smartest thing to do, but I’m a botanist. That’s what I told Bunny, but she just rolled her eye. I’m not dead yet, so that’s a good sign.

Definitely not a natural formation. Had to work my way through some new overgrowth, but there is a door. I repeat: we have a door. I am pretty sure I didn’t make this door, so there is, or was, some sort of advanced life on this planet at some point. What I would like to find out is what is behind said door, but so far I’ve been unable to open it. It has a smooth metal surface, and there is no sign of a handle. There are some symbols, but I’m not sure if they serve a function, or are just decorative. I would settle for at least a doorbell at this point.

I had the strangest dream last night. I climbed a giant pizza mountain. The crust was the base and it was just a single giant slice over a 1000 feet high. I clambered over hamburg boulders and scaled pepperoni slices, but I made it to the top. From the top of Mount Pizza, I could see the house I grew up in. I don’t remember how I got there, but suddenly I was in front of the house, and walked inside. No one was home. I was filled with panic as I desperately searched for my family inside the house. I grew more and more scared until finally I woke up.
As strange as that dream was, it was even more bizarre to realize I woke up and I’m still on an alien planet. I could really go for some pizza.

Made a trip back to the facility for more supplies. Really wish the vehicle bay was operational. Brought back a mining laser, but it had no effect on the door. Stupidly burned myself touching the door after. The structure itself is the size of a small shack. I’m not sure if I’ve stumbled upon an ancient secret facility, or an ancient alien storage shed.
On a more important note, I spotted more animal tracks. I have the feeling that we're being followed.

It’s open. I’m not sure how or why, but the doorway was open this morning. There is just a small empty room inside. There is a panel just inside the door with some sort of controls. Bunny thinks it could be some sort of elevator. It very well could be. I’ve cleared my usual busy schedule to tinker with the controls. Wish me luck.
A glowing plant bulb containing a cluster of sticky fibrous membranes.
A sweet fruit that looks a bit like an orange banana.
A strange and pointy grain plant that can be processed to make flour.
A spongy, and sorta slimy, vegetable crop.
An edible polyphyletic organism. This could also be used to generate nutrients for better plant growth.
A large blue capped edible fungus.
A flowering plant with a deep crimson bloom.
A strange alien fish with red fins on the front and rear. A large yellow eye sits near the middle of it's body.
A small red and black fish that lives predominantly in cave waters.
An elongated and soft bodied animal that is strikingly familiar to an ordinary earth worm. The animal is commonly found in the underground waterways.
A sophisticated means of displaying light. With some further study we can use these for decorations.
A strange stack of metal glowing spheres. Not sure what they're for, but they sure look cool.
Blueprint detailing how to create a cloning system. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create a memory transfer system. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create a robot assembly machine. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create an aeroponics farm. Further research will be required.
It looks rather complicated, but the blueprint illustrates a way of manipulating light to create holgrams.
Blueprints detailing how to create a new vehicle. Further research required.
Blueprints detailing how to create a new vehicle. Further research required.
Blueprints detailing how to create a new vehicle. Further research required.
Blueprints detailing how to create a new vehicle. Further research required.
Blueprints detailing how to create a new vehicle. Further research required.
Blueprint detailing how to create a sturdy back brace to increase colonist strength. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create a sturdier robot frame to increase robot strength. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create a stylish and functional running shoe. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create better servos to increase robotic movement. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create a neural stimulator. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create an advanced microship to increase robotic intelligence. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create an advanced power supply. These should further improve power consumption efficiency. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create an advanced inlet valve to improve water usage efficiency. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create an advanced pump motor to increase water pump output. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create an advanced creaft efficieny module. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create an advanced power coil to increase power output. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create an improved version of our battery boosters to increase power storage capacity. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create an improved version of our storage technology to further increase storage capacity. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create an advanced engine for increased vehicle speed. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create an advanced scanner device for increased scanning speed. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create an advanced mining laser for increased vehicle mining speed. Further research will be required.
Blueprint detailing how to create an advanced cargo expander for increased vehicle cargo capacity. Further research will be required.
Here we can get an overview of our colonists and manage job roles, equipment and view our colony status.
The research window is where we can unlock new technologies, recipes and more by spending research points, Tech Fragments and/or Bio-Samples.
There are many things to discover including blueprints, resources and data. This is where we can view what we have discovered.
The planet map interface is where you can manage expeditions, surface structures and vehicles. An elevator needs to be constructed before we have access to the surface.
The planet map interface is where you can manage expeditions, surface structures and vehicles.
A starting supply chest has been left near the stasis capsules by an unknown benefactor. Select the chest and press the Open button.

Your colonists are currently in stasis capsules. Click on a stasis capsule and click open to get them out.
Colonists can have 3 job roles assigned at a time. These can be changed by clicking the job role button in their info panel.

We'll need some structure resin to get started. We don't currently have the means to process materials so we'll have to deconstruct walls/flooring for structure resin. The Builder job role is responsible for deconstructing objects.
Click the deconstruct button on the main button bar and select walls or floors. Hold LMB + Drag to select wall debris to be mined. Drag over already selected tile to deselect.
Colonist job roles can be re-assigned by clicking on the respective job role button.
We'll need to regain access to the top side facility by constructing an elevator. Scans indicate the solar panels are still functional. We can route power from the elevator.
Growing crops is important for food and refining materials. Find and select the crop field from the build menu under production. Must be placed on dirt floor.

In order to refine materials such as structure resin and bioplastic we'll need a Bio-Refiner.
The Bio-Refiner must be constructed on refinery flooring and connected to power. Construct power conduits from the EMG to the Bio-Refiner.
We'll need to get power going before we can start research projects. Construct a room using Utility Floor and place an EMG. The EMG will need to be charged up by a colonist.

Research points are generated at the Research Station by a colonist with the scientist job role. Research points are used to unlock research projects.
The Research Station must be constructed on science lab flooring and requires power. Construct power conduits from the power generator to the Research Station.
Open the Research Projects screen from the bottom button bar and choose an available project from the list. Once you have enough research points a research project can be unlocked.

Colonists awoken from stasis will already have one primary job assigned. Colonists can have up to three jobs assigned.
Left Click on a colonist to select them. Then click on a job slot in their info panel to assign or change the job in that slot.
Job priority is based on the primary, secondary and tertiary job slots. Primary jobs will be attempted first and so on.
